# webView(_:didReceive:completionHandler:)

**Instance Method**

Asks the delegate to respond to an authentication challenge.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func webView(_ webView: WKWebView, didReceive challenge: URLAuthenticationChallenge, completionHandler: @escaping @MainActor (URLSession.AuthChallengeDisposition, URLCredential?) -> Void)
```

```swift
@MainActor optional func webView(_ webView: WKWebView, respondTo challenge: URLAuthenticationChallenge) async -> (URLSession.AuthChallengeDisposition, URLCredential?)
```

## Parameters

- **webView**: The web view that receives the authentication challenge.
- **challenge**: The authentication challenge.
- **completionHandler**: A completion handler block to execute with the response. This handler has no return value and takes the following parameters:



## Discussion

If you don’t implement this method, the web view responds to the authentication challenge with the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/URLSession/AuthChallengeDisposition/rejectProtectionSpace] disposition.

## Responding to authentication challenges

- **webView(_:authenticationChallenge:shouldAllowDeprecatedTLS:)**: Asks the delegate whether to continue with a connection that uses a deprecated version of TLS.
